#Text=Civil unrest forces out Ecuador 's president
#Text=Thursday , April 21 , 2005
#Text=Amid unrest in the Ecuadoran capital city of Quito , President General Lucio Gutierrez has been removed from his office by congress .
#Text=Vice-President Alfredo Palacio was voted in unanimously by deputies to replace Mr Gutierrez who is accused of abandoning his post .
#Text=The BBC reports Gutierrez left the presidential palace by helicopter after sparking protests when he tried to overhaul the Supreme Court .
#Text=He is now in the Brazilian embassy in Quito where he has applied for asylum ( www.planetmafia.net ) , as confirmed by the Brazilian department of foreign affairs .
#Text=In the worst political turmoil experienced in Quito in nearly a century , panic is evident .
#Text=Many families have rushed to supermarkets to stock up in anticipation of further violence .
#Text=The cause of this panic is the sudden escalation of violence in the protests and anti-government demonstrations that have been underway for a week .
#Text=Protests began as a reaction to the government ’s unconstitutional appointment of a partisan Supreme Court .

#Text=Last week , the inability of the Congress to resolve the problem led broadcaster Radio La Luna to call for a spontaneous demonstration against the government by the citizenry , without the intervention of politicians .
#Text=The success of this demonstration caused it to be repeated each night when thousands of people went into the streets singing and banging on kitchenware .

#Text=On Friday , President Gutierrez , a self proclaimed " dictocrat " ( dictator for the opposition but democrat to his supporters ) , declared a state of emergency in Quito , and suspended all civil liberties in the capital .
#Text=( In the past , this president has not shown himself to be a friend of the constitutional order , and was part of a 2001 coup which overthrew President Jamil Mahuad ) .
#Text=The president sent armed forces to shut down Radio La Luna , but when the troops were met by thousands of unarmed civilians , they stepped down .
#Text=The President was forced to cancel the state of emergency within 24 hours given the tumultuous uproar .
#Text=The government instead called its supporters from the provinces to come to Quito and fight the protesters in the streets .
#Text=Renan Borbua , one of the President 's staunchest allies in Guayaquil , announced that buses packed with cudgel and machete-wielding thugs were on their way to Quito .
#Text=Quito ’s Mayor Paco Moncayo , and the prefect of Pichincha declared the highways closed and refused the ‘ thugs ’ a way into Quito .
#Text=Nonetheless many government sympathizers were reported near the capital , looting stores and destroying parked automobiles .
#Text=The government also ordered the National Police to suppress the protesters , a move leading Quito ’s mayor to declare that the National Police were no longer viewed as legitimate in the city .
#Text=Also as a response to the President ’s order , the Commander of the National Police resigned in protest , but was promptly replaced by the President ’s own cousin .
#Text=So far the Police have killed one person , a Chilean reporter , and injured hundreds .
#Text=Roads are blocked , and numerous fires have been started as a response to the Police ’s use of riot-gas .
#Text=It is unclear where the Ecuadorian military stands on this issue .
#Text=Both sides have claimed its support .

#Text=Ecuador ’s provinces have been declaring themselves for or against the government , and depending on the ultimate position of the military , civil war looms as a dire possibility in everyone ’s minds .
